intro: Alectra sessiliflora f. barbata, commonly known as the barbed sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that features small, fleshy, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant is characterized by its distinctive barbed bracts, which give it its common name. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments. This variety is often found in regions of North America, particularly in the southwestern United States and parts of Mexico.
